reasoning: Pituitary adenomas have an incidence of ~2.7 per 100k person-years based on population-based registry studies. Prevalence reported as ~77 per 100k from autopsy and MRI studies due to many asymptomatic cases. Well-defined condition with established epidemiological data.
source: Fernandez A et al. (2010). Prevalence of pituitary adenomas: a community-based, cross-sectional study in Banbury (Oxfordshire, UK). Clin Endocrinol (Oxf). 72(3):377-382
